Di Bali, Foodies Bisa Makan Enak dan Belajar Bikin Kopi di Sini
02 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Jakarta - Saat liburan ke Bali, banyak hal yang bisa dilakukan. Bagi foodies, cobalah sambangi satu area yang dijamin bisa bikin liburan seru sekaligus kenyang.Berlokasi di Tabanan, ada Secret Garden Village (SGV) yang bisa jadi tempat wisata seru bagi pencinta kuliner. Area ini memiliki 3 restoran sekaligus. Selain bisa puas makan, pengunjung juga bisa mengikuti berbagai aktivitas seru.Di sini bisa makan hidangan khas Bali, menikmati teh di tengah sawah hingga belajar membuat latte art. Dengan tiket masuk sebesar Rp 50 ribu, berikut beberapa kegiatan yang bisa dilakukan foodies saat menyambangi Secret Garden Village, Tabanan.1. Santap kuliner khas Bali


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Untuk mencapai Secret Garden Village memang dibutuhkan waktu kurang lebih 2 jam dari Bandara I Gusti Ngurah Rai. Tapi area ini bisa jadi one stop traveling, termasuk bagi para pencinta kuliner. Berbagai hidangan khas Bali bisa dicicip di restoran Bebek Timbungan dan The Luwus.Restoran dengan area makan yang luas ini menyediakan menu khas Bali dengan cita rasa autentik. Menu populer seperti menu megibung, bebek betutu, lawar, dan menu bebek timbungan yang jadi menu andalannya. Sambil makan, pengunjung akan dimanjakan dengan pemandangan sawah yang luas.Baca juga : Bebek Timbungan : Begini Kelezatan Bebek Legendaris Santapan Raja Bali2. Ngopi dan belajar membuat latte art


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Puas makan, di sini juga bisa duduk santai sambil ngopi cantik. Ada Black Eye Coffee and Roastery yang bisa jadi tempat santai menikmati semilir angin pegunungan.Coffee shop ini bukan hanya bisa jadi tempat ngopi karena pengunjung juga bisa merasakan sensasi belajar membuat latte art. Barista di coffee shop ini akan menuntun pengunjung agar bisa membuat latte art cantik. Nantinya kopi racikan sendiri bisa dinikmati langsung.3. Menikmati teh di tengah sawah


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Sore-sore jadi waktu yang tepat untuk menikmati secangkir teh dan kue tradisional khas Bali. Di restoran Rice View pengunjung bisa minum secangkir teh di tengah sawah. Resto ini memang menyediakan sofa persis di tengah sawah padi.Minum teh hangat dan kudapan khas Bali bisa jadi pengalaman menarik sekaligus melepas penat. Semilir angin dan kicauan burung menambah sensasi alami ngeteh di sawah.Nah waktu paling tepat menikmati teh ini adalah sore hari.4. Membuat sabun bentuk makanan


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Puas makan, pengunjung juga bisa belajar membuat sabun dengan bentuk makanan. Staf di sini akan mengajak pengunjung meracik sabun dari berbagai bahan alami. Oya sabun juga dilengkapi dengan scrub dari gula pasir dan oatmeal.Uniknya, sabun buatan sendiri ini juga bisa dibentuk sesuai selera. Ada bentuk buah-buahan seperti anggur, pisang dan srikaya atau bentuk makanan mungil seperti cupcakes dan macarons. Nantinya sabun ini bisa dibawa pulang lho.Baca juga : 5 Alasan Makanan Khas Bali Jadi Favorit Para Chef Internasional5. Jalan-jalan di pematang sawah


Foto: Devi S. Lestari/detikFood

Area wisata yang luas ini juga punya sawah padi yang bisa dijelajahi. Pengunjung bisa berjalan-jalan di pematang sawah sambil melihat padi yang tumbuh. Sayangnya, detikFood datang saat musim kemarau jadi sawah padinya sedang mengering.Selain bisa menjelajah sawah padi, di sini juga tersedia beberapa area spot foto instagenik. Nah kalau ke Bali, sempatkan mampir ke sini agar bisa merasakan pengalaman seru sambil berwisata kuliner. text:
In Bali, Foodies Can Eat Tasty and Learn to Make Coffee Here
02 Nov 2019, 08:00 by Devi Setya - detikFood


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Jakarta - When on vacation to Bali, many things can be done. For foodies, try to visit one area that is guaranteed to make an exciting holiday at the same time full. Located in Tabanan, there is a Secret Garden Village (SGV) which can be an exciting tourist spot for culinary lovers. This area has 3 restaurants at the same time. In addition to being satisfied eating, visitors can also participate in various exciting activities. Here you can eat Balinese specialties, enjoy tea in the middle of rice fields to learn to make latte art. With an entrance ticket of Rp. 50 thousand, here are some activities foodies can do when visiting Secret Garden Village, Tabanan. Balinese cuisine


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

To reach the Secret Garden Village, it takes approximately 2 hours from I Gusti Ngurah Rai Airport. But this area can be one stop traveling, including for foodies. Various Balinese dishes can be tasted at the Bebek Timbungan and The Luwus restaurants. This restaurant with a large dining area provides authentic Balinese menus with authentic flavors. Popular menus such as the megibung menu, betutu duck, lawar, and the scales duck menu are the mainstay menus. While eating, visitors will be spoiled by the view of the vast rice fields. Also read: Duck Timbungan: Here's the Legendary Deliciousness of Bali's Fine Dining King2. Coffee and learn to make latte art


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Satisfied eating, here can also sit and relax while drinking beautiful. There is a Black Eye Coffee and Roastery that can be a relaxing place to enjoy the breezy mountain breeze. This coffee shop can not only be a coffee place because visitors can also feel the sensation of learning to make latte art. Barista in this coffee shop will guide visitors to be able to make beautiful latte art. Later, the concoction itself can be enjoyed immediately.3. Enjoy tea in the middle of rice fields


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Afternoons are the perfect time to enjoy a cup of tea and traditional Balinese cakes. At the Rice View restaurant visitors can drink a cup of tea in the middle of rice fields. This restaurant does provide a sofa right in the middle of a rice paddy. Drinking warm tea and Balinese snacks can be an interesting experience while releasing fatigue. The breeze and the birds singing add to the natural sensation of ngeteh in the rice fields. The best time to enjoy this tea is in the afternoon. Make food soap


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

Satisfied eating, visitors can also learn to make soap in the form of food. The staff here will invite visitors to mix soap from a variety of natural ingredients. Oya soap is also equipped with a scrub of granulated sugar and oatmeal. Interestingly, this homemade soap can also be shaped according to taste. There are forms of fruits such as grapes, bananas and sugar apple or small food forms such as cupcakes and macarons. Later this soap can be taken home lho.Read also: 5 Reasons for Typical Balinese Food Become a Favorite of International Chefs5. Take a walk in the rice fields


Photo: Devi S. Lestari / detikFood

This spacious tourist area also has paddy fields that can be explored. Visitors can take a walk in the rice fields while watching the rice grow. Unfortunately, detikFood comes during the dry season so the paddy fields are dry. Besides being able to explore paddy fields, here are also some instagenic photo spot areas. Now if you go to Bali, make time to stop by here so you can experience exciting experiences while on a culinary tour.
